intro: Stillingia salpingadenia var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic-stemmed stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and fine, irritating hairs that cause a skin reaction upon contact. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. The flowering stems are usually erect and bear small, greenish flowers that develop into dry, capsule-like fruits.
